page.title: 12ETHNIC MATTERS IN DUDLEY (1)
page.content: Dudley people are from a wide range of backgrounds, and recent Asian immigrants have brought their own{ {languages.}Punjabi is spoken by those from the Punjab in Northern India, Gujarati by those from the West coast and Urdu by those from West Pakistan. These languages are reflected in local newsagents and{libraries.}Most families raise their children to be bi-lingual. In addition to languages, the Asians have brought their{religions,} mainly Muslim, Sikh and Hindu. In all three prayer is an important element. The children also take part in school assemblies. Because of their beliefs the{life style}of these families is sometimes different from their neighbours. Some families are very close and do not mix freely, others try to integrate to different degrees.
